problem.markdown:
Which of the following are correct statements regarding a Terrain Run? [x] Terrain running is designed to be conducted with small unit integrity, best performed by squads and sections. [ ] Distances should generally be 5 miles for densely wooded areas and up to 10 miles on tank trails and open fields. [ ] Intensity is not relative to the terrain. Equal intensity should be maintained for all types of terrain. [x] Soldiers should perform terrain running in ACUs and well-fitting boots. [x] Soldiers may progress to performing terrain running with IBA, ACH, individual weapon, and under fighting load.
[explanation] Terrain running is designed to be conducted with small unit integrity. Distances should generally be 1 mile for densely wooded areas and up to 2 miles on tank trails and open fields. Intensity is relative to the terrain. Soldiers should perform terrain running in ACUs and well-fitting boots. Soldiers may progress to performing terrain running with IBA, ACH, individual weapon, and under fighting load. [explanation]
